entry.title: Add restriction when logging to SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Are there ways in restricting access to SAP Public Cloud using VPN or through IP Address?

Client would like to make sure that their users can access SAP Public Cloud using their company network.

entry.title: HOW TO DO SAP EWM PACKING REPACKING AND UNPACKING
entry.content:
1. Move stock from one HU to a new HU           
 2. Move stock from one HU to an existing HU          
 3. Move stock from a bin to an HU                 
4. Move stock from an HU to a bin               
 5. Move stock from a bin to a new HU 

 

***  " FOR HU TO existing HU MOVEMENT
  IF p_hu IS NOT INITIAL AND p2dest_h IS NOT INITIAL.
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->get_instance
      IMPORTING
*       es_hu_main  =                  " Structure with GLobal Fields and Indicators in Packing
        eo_instance = lo_packing. " Packing in WM with Immediately Confirmed Transfer Orders

    CALL METHOD lo_packing->init
      EXPORTING
        iv_lgnum = p_whnum "XYZ''     " Warehouse Number/Warehouse Complex
*       is_pack_controle       =                  " Structure with Fields for Packing Control
*       iv_procty              =                  " Warehouse Process Type
*       iv_execute_whr_cleanup = 'X'              " Checkbox
      EXCEPTIONS
        error    = 1                " Error, see log
        OTHERS   = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
*   WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
    ENDIF.


    CALL FUNCTION '/SCWM/TO_INIT_NEW'
      EXPORTING
        iv_lgnum = p_whnum "XYZ'
*       IO_PROT  =
      .
    SELECT SINGLE guid_hu FROM /scwm/huhdr INTO lv_guid_hu WHERE huident = p_hu AND lgnum = p_whnum.
    SELECT SINGLE lgpla FROM /scwm/aqua INTO lv_lgpla WHERE huident = p_hu AND lgnum = p_whnum.

    CALL METHOD lo_packing->get_hu
      EXPORTING
        iv_huident = p_hu "'00000000000300000039' " Handling Unit Identification
        iv_guid_hu = lv_guid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6F319AAFCF49C0B' " Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit
*       iv_lock    =                  " Single-Character Indicator
*       iv_nlevel  =                  " Single-Character Flag
      IMPORTING
*       et_huident =
        et_huitm   = gt_huitm " Material Items in the HU
*       es_huhdr   =                  " Internal Structure for Processing the HU Header
*       et_huhdr   =                  " Table Type for HU Headers in the Internal Structure
*       et_hutree  =                  " Table with HU Hierarchy Entries
*       et_huref   =                  " Table with HU References
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found  = 1
        OTHERS     = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
*   WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
    ENDIF.

    READ TABLE gt_huitm INTO ls_huitm INDEX 1.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      IF lines( lt_serial_c ) <= ls_huitm-quan.
        ls_quantity-quan = lines( lt_serial_c ).
        ls_quantity-unit = ls_huitm-meins.
      ELSE.
        MESSAGE e540(zewm)."MESSAGE : 'ENTERD QTY IS EXCEEDING THE HU QTY' TYPE 'E'.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT SINGLE guid_hu FROM /scwm/huhdr INTO @LV_dguid_hu WHERE huident = @p2dest_h AND lgnum = @p_whnum.
    " Call repack_stock method
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->repack_stock
      EXPORTING
        iv_dest_hu    = lv_dguid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6F34FE6EA5D5C0B' "lv_dest_hu1" Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit
        iv_source_hu  = lv_guid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6F319AAFCF49C0B' "lv_source_hu" Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit"
        iv_stock_guid = ls_huitm-guid_stock "lv_stock_guid " GUID Stock Item
        is_quantity   = ls_quantity " Quantity Structure
*       is_valuation  =                  " Quantity Structure
*       iv_cwexact    =                  " Status of Valuation Quantity
*       it_serid      =                  " Serial Number
*       iv_no_event   = ' '              " Data Element for Domain BOOLE: TRUE (="X") and FALSE (=" ")
*       iv_addin      =                  " Data Type Dependent on Implementing Class
*  IMPORTING
*       es_quantity   =                  " Quantity Structure
      EXCEPTIONS
        error         = 1                " See Log
        OTHERS        = 2.


    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      CALL METHOD lo_packing->save
        EXPORTING
          iv_commit = 'X'
          iv_wait   = 'X'
        EXCEPTIONS
          error     = 1                " See Log
          OTHERS    = 2.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
    ENDIF.

****    HU TO BIN (UNPACK)
  ELSEIF p_hu IS NOT INITIAL AND p2_de_bi IS NOT INITIAL.
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->init
      EXPORTING
        iv_lgnum = p_whnum. "'XYZ'.          " Warehouse Number/Warehouse Complex
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      CALL METHOD /scwm/cl_wm_packing=>set_global_fields
        EXPORTING
          iv_lgnum = p_whnum "'XYZ'      " Warehouse Number/Warehouse Complex
        EXCEPTIONS
          error    = 1
          OTHERS   = 2.

      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CALL FUNCTION '/SCWM/TO_INIT_NEW'
          EXPORTING
            iv_lgnum = p_whnum "'XYZ'
*           IO_PROT  =
          .
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
    CLEAR : lv_guid_hu.
    SELECT SINGLE guid_hu FROM /scwm/huhdr INTO lv_guid_hu WHERE huident = p_hu AND lgnum = p_whnum.
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->get_hu
      EXPORTING
        iv_huident = p_hu "'300000037' " Handling Unit Identification
        iv_guid_hu = lv_guid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6DDB454F1CF5C0B' " Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit
*       iv_lock    =                  " Single-Character Indicator
*       iv_nlevel  =                  " Single-Character Flag
      IMPORTING
*       et_huident =
        et_huitm   = gt_huitm " Material Items in the HU
*       es_huhdr   =                  " Internal Structure for Processing the HU Header
*       et_huhdr   =                  " Table Type for HU Headers in the Internal Structure
*       et_hutree  =                  " Table with HU Hierarchy Entries
*       et_huref   =                  " Table with HU References
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found  = 1
        OTHERS     = 2.
    READ TABLE gt_huitm INTO ls_huitm INDEX 1.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      IF lines( lt_serial_c ) <= ls_huitm-quan.
        ls_quantity-quan = lines( lt_serial_c ).
        ls_quantity-unit = ls_huitm-meins.
      ELSE.
        MESSAGE e540(zewm)."MESSAGE : 'ENTERD QTY IS EXCEEDING THE HU QTY' TYPE 'E'.
        CALL SCREEN 300.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->/scwm/if_pack_bas~unpack_stock
      EXPORTING
        iv_source_hu  = lv_guid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6DDB454F1CF5C0B' " Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit
        iv_stock_guid = ls_huitm-guid_stock " GUID Stock Item
        is_quantity   = ls_quantity " Quantity Structure
*       is_valuation  =                  " Quantity Structure
*       iv_cwexact    =                  " Status of Valuation Quantity
*       it_serid      =                  " Serial Number
        iv_dest_lgpla = p2_de_bi "'APGR-01' " Storage Bin
*       iv_addin      =                  " Data Type Dependent on Implementing Class
*       iv_altuom     =                  " new alt.UoM for HU item
*  IMPORTING
*       es_quantity   =                  " Quantity Structure
      EXCEPTIONS
        error         = 1                " See Log
        OTHERS        = 2.
    IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
      CALL METHOD lo_packing->save
        EXPORTING
          iv_commit = 'X'
          iv_wait   = 'X'
        EXCEPTIONS
          error     = 1                " See Log
          OTHERS    = 2.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
    ENDIF.

***    "hu to new hu
  ELSEIF p_hu IS NOT INITIAL AND p2_new_d IS NOT INITIAL.

    CREATE OBJECT g_create.

    CALL METHOD g_create->init
      EXPORTING
        iv_lgnum = p_whnum     " Warehouse Number/Warehouse Complex
*       is_pack_controle       =                  " Structure with Fields for Packing Control
*       iv_procty              =                  " Warehouse Process Type
*       iv_execute_whr_cleanup = 'X'              " Checkbox
      EXCEPTIONS
        error    = 1                " Error, see log
        OTHERS   = 2.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.

      CALL FUNCTION '/SCWM/TO_INIT_NEW'
        EXPORTING
          iv_lgnum = p_whnum
*         IO_PROT  =
        .
    ENDIF.
    CLEAR : es_huhdr.

    CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MDLPD_INPUT'
      EXPORTING
        input  = p2_new_d
      IMPORTING
        output = lv_pmat.

    "reading bin for sourse hu
    CALL FUNCTION '/SCWM/HUHEADER_READ'
      EXPORTING
        iv_appl      = 'WME'
        iv_huident   = p_hu
        iv_db_select = 'X'
      IMPORTING
        et_huheader  = gt_huheader
*      EXCEPTIONS
*       NOT_FOUND    = 1
*       INPUT        = 2
*       ERROR        = 3
*       DELETED      = 4
*       OTHERS       = 5
      .
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    ENDIF.
    LOOP AT gt_huheader INTO DATA(ls_huheader) WHERE huident = p_hu AND lgnum = p_whnum.
      EXIT.
    ENDLOOP.

    "create new hu
    CALL METHOD g_create->/scwm/if_pack_bas~create_hu
      EXPORTING
        iv_pmat    = lv_pmat " Material GUID16 with Conversion Exit
*       iv_huident =                  " Handling Unit Identification
*       is_hu_create =
*       iv_nohuident =                  " Single-Character Indicator
        i_location = ls_huheader-lgpla "'
*       iv_loghu   =                  " Handling Unit Identification
      RECEIVING
        es_huhdr   = es_huhdr " Internal Structure for Processing the HU Header
      EXCEPTIONS
        error      = 1
        OTHERS     = 2.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      CALL METHOD g_create->save
        EXPORTING
          iv_commit = 'X'
          iv_wait   = 'X'
        EXCEPTIONS
          error     = 1                " See Log
          OTHERS    = 2.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*   MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
*     WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
    "END OF NEW HU


    "MOVE HU TO NEW HU
    WAIT UP TO 5 SECONDS.
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->get_instance
      IMPORTING
*       es_hu_main  =                  " Structure with GLobal Fields and Indicators in Packing
        eo_instance = lo_packing. " Packing in WM with Immediately Confirmed Transfer Orders

    CALL METHOD lo_packing->init
      EXPORTING
        iv_lgnum = p_whnum "'XYZ'     " Warehouse Number/Warehouse Complex
*       is_pack_controle       =                  " Structure with Fields for Packing Control
*       iv_procty              =                  " Warehouse Process Type
*       iv_execute_whr_cleanup = 'X'              " Checkbox
      EXCEPTIONS
        error    = 1                " Error, see log
        OTHERS   = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
*   WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
    ENDIF.


    CALL FUNCTION '/SCWM/TO_INIT_NEW'
      EXPORTING
        iv_lgnum = p_whnum "'XYZ'
*       IO_PROT  =
      .
    SELECT SINGLE guid_hu FROM /scwm/huhdr INTO lv_guid_hu WHERE huident = p_hu AND lgnum = p_whnum.

    CALL METHOD lo_packing->get_hu
      EXPORTING
        iv_huident = p_hu "'00000000000300000039' " Handling Unit Identification
        iv_guid_hu = lv_guid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6F319AAFCF49C0B' " Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit
*       iv_lock    =                  " Single-Character Indicator
*       iv_nlevel  =                  " Single-Character Flag
      IMPORTING
*       et_huident =
        et_huitm   = gt_huitm " Material Items in the HU
*       es_huhdr   =                  " Internal Structure for Processing the HU Header
*       et_huhdr   =                  " Table Type for HU Headers in the Internal Structure
*       et_hutree  =                  " Table with HU Hierarchy Entries
*       et_huref   =                  " Table with HU References
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found  = 1
        OTHERS     = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* MESSAGE ID SY-MSGID TYPE SY-MSGTY NUMBER SY-MSGNO
*   WITH SY-MSGV1 SY-MSGV2 SY-MSGV3 SY-MSGV4.
    ENDIF.

    READ TABLE gt_huitm INTO ls_huitm INDEX 1.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      IF lines( lt_serial_c ) <= ls_huitm-quan.
        ls_quantity-quan = lines( lt_serial_c ).
        ls_quantity-unit = ls_huitm-meins.
      ELSE.
        MESSAGE e540(zewm)."MESSAGE : 'ENTERD QTY IS EXCEEDING THE HU QTY' TYPE 'E'.
        CALL SCREEN 300.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT SINGLE guid_hu FROM /scwm/huhdr INTO @LV_dguid_hu WHERE huident = @ES_huhdr-huident AND lgnum = @p_whnum.
    " Call repack_stock method
    CALL METHOD lo_packing->repack_stock
      EXPORTING
        iv_dest_hu    = lv_dguid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6F34FE6EA5D5C0B' "lv_dest_hu1" Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit
        iv_source_hu  = lv_guid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A6F319AAFCF49C0B' "lv_source_hu" Unique Internal Identification of a Handling Unit"
        iv_stock_guid = ls_huitm-guid_stock "lv_stock_guid " GUID Stock Item
        is_quantity   = ls_quantity " Quantity Structure
*       is_valuation  =                  " Quantity Structure
*       iv_cwexact    =                  " Status of Valuation Quantity
*       it_serid      =                  " Serial Number
*       iv_no_event   = ' '              " Data Element for Domain BOOLE: TRUE (="X") and FALSE (=" ")
*       iv_addin      =                  " Data Type Dependent on Implementing Class
*  IMPORTING
*       es_quantity   =                  " Quantity Structure
      EXCEPTIONS
        error         = 1                " See Log
        OTHERS        = 2.


    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      CALL METHOD lo_packing->save
        EXPORTING
          iv_commit = 'X'
          iv_wait   = 'X'
        EXCEPTIONS
          error     = 1                " See Log
          OTHERS    = 2.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
    ENDIF.

***    "BIN TO HU (PACKING)

     APPEND VALUE #( sign = 'I'
                option = 'EQ'
                low = p2_src_b"'APGR-01'
                high = '' ) TO mt_lgplanw.
      CREATE OBJECT mo_ei_hu_obj.

      CALL METHOD mo_ei_hu_obj->/scwm/if_ex_hu_select~select
        EXPORTING
          iv_lgnum     = p_whnum "'' "mv_lgnum'
          iv_hierarchy = 'L' "lc_l
          ir_lgpla     = mt_lgplanw
        IMPORTING
          et_guid_hu   = mt_hu
        EXCEPTIONS
          wrong_input  = 1
          error        = 2
          OTHERS       = 3.
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        ls_main_data-appl = 'WME'."lc_wme.
        ls_main_data-lgnum = p_whnum."'VCK1'."mv_lgnum.
        ls_main_data-details = abap_true.
        ls_main_data-lgpla = p2_src_b."''.
        CREATE OBJECT mo_packing_obj.

        CALL METHOD mo_packing_obj->/scwm/if_pack_bas~hu_gt_fill
          EXPORTING
            is_main_data = ls_main_data
            it_guid_hu   = mt_hu
          IMPORTING
            et_huhdr     = DATA(lt_huhdr) ##NEEDED
            et_ident     = DATA(lt_ident) ##NEEDED
            et_huitm     = DATA(lt_huitm) ##NEEDED
          EXCEPTIONS
            error        = 1
            OTHERS       = 2.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          /scwm/cl_log=>get_instance( IMPORTING eo_instance = mo_prot ).

          CALL FUNCTION '/SCWM/TO_INIT_NEW'
            EXPORTING
              iv_lgnum = p_whnum
              io_prot  = mo_prot.


          CALL METHOD mo_packing_obj->init
            EXPORTING
              iv_lgnum = p_whnum "''
            EXCEPTIONS
              error    = 1
              OTHERS   = 2.
          IF lv_guid_stock IS INITIAL AND  lv_guid_parent IS INITIAL.
            lv_guid_parent = ls_faqua-guid_parent." '000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A4C631C0D4825C07' .
            lv_guid_stock  = ls_faqua-guid_stock." '000D3A2BB8FF1FE0A2B126227A25BC03' .
          ENDIF.
          ls_quantity-quan = lv_fqty."'2'.
          ls_quantity-unit = ls_faqua-unit. "'L'.

          SELECT SINGLE guid_hu FROM /scwm/huhdr INTO @LV_dguid_hu WHERE huident = @p2dest_h AND lgnum = @p_whnum.

          CALL METHOD mo_packing_obj->/scwm/if_pack_bas~repack_stock
            EXPORTING
              iv_dest_hu    = lv_dguid_hu "'000D3A2BB8FF1FD0AEE6AB7139E5A000' "ms_hundlernw-guid_hu
              iv_source_hu  = lv_guid_parent
              iv_stock_guid = lv_guid_stock
              is_quantity   = ls_quantity
*             it_serid      = lt_serid
            EXCEPTIONS
              error         = 1
              OTHERS        = 2.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            mo_packing_obj->/scwm/if_pack_bas~save(
                        EXPORTING
                          iv_commit = abap_true
                          iv_wait   = abap_true
                        EXCEPTIONS
                          error     = 1                " See Log
                          OTHERS    = 2
                      ).

            IF sy-subrc = 0.
            
    ENDIF.

***     "SOURCE BIN TO NEW HU

    CALL FUNCTION '/SCMB/MDL_KEYC_BY_MATNR_SNL' ##FM_SUBRC_OK
      EXPORTING
        iv_matnr = p_matnr
      IMPORTING
        ev_matid = ls_create-matid.

  CREATE OBJECT g_create1.

      CALL METHOD g_create1->init
        EXPORTING
          iv_lgnum = p_whnum     " Warehouse Number/Warehouse Complex

entry.title: Re: Unsupported OData Version 4.01 when connecting Fiori...
entry.content:
Hello,

the Sales Order and Sales Order Simulation API using features that are added to the OData protocol with the Version 4.01 and therefore the metadata also define the version as such. The support for this version for was added at a later point in time as the purpose auf these services is not UI primarily. But of cause they can be used for that purpose.

Meanwhile, since Version 1.142 support is added, see What's new . You can get more details here: Transition to OData V4.01 

When you increase the Fiori version accordingly, you are able to resolve this issue.

entry.title: How AI Solutions Can Align with SAPs Clean Core Principles
entry.content:
Clean core and Artificial Intelligence are often discussed in isolation. Clean core is positioned to reduce technical debt and keep SAP S/4HANA upgradeable, while AI is usually associated with new workloads, additional components, and non-SAP technologies such as Python.

This separation leads to a common misconception: that AI solutions, especially those implemented in Python or using external models, are incompatible with a clean core strategy.

In practice, AI and clean core are closely aligned. SAPs own definition of an ERP clean core emphasizes standardization, modern extensibility, and the ability to leverage reliable data and AI innovations on top of a stable core. When designed correctly, AI solutions can fully comply with clean core principles and in many cases help to realize the intended benefits of the strategy.

SAP Clean Core Strategy

SAP describes an ERP clean core strategy as a set of guiding principles to keep business critical systems agile, cost-effective, and ready to adopt innovation. Key elements include:

  • Reduction of historically grown complexity and custom code in the core ERP system.
  • Standardization of processes by staying close to SAP best practices.
  • Use of modern extensibility options, particularly side-by-side extensions on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP).
  • API- first and event-driven integration, rather than direct database access.
  • Cloud readiness and continuous innovation, including the ability to exploit AI capabilities.

Clean core does not prohibit custom logic or non-ABAP technology. It defines where that logic should run (outside the S/4 core) and how it should integrate (through released, supported interfaces).

Principles Relevant for AI Solutions

For AI initiatives, the following clean core principles are particularly relevant:

  • Decoupled innovation: AI workloads should run outside the S/4HANA core, typically on SAP BTP, and consume data via published APIs or data services.
  • Use of official extensibility models: Extensions should follow the models described in SAPs clean core and extensibility guidance, including in-app extensions, developer extensibility (ABAP Cloud), and side-by-side extensions.
  • API-first and event-driven patterns: AI components should use official APIs and events to interact with core applications, rather than relying on direct table access or modifications.
  • Governed data access: Data for AI models should be accessed through governed layers such as SAP HANA Cloud or SAP Datasphere, which preserve security, compliance and lineage.

If an AI architecture respects these principles, it is aligned with the clean core strategy, regardless of the programming language or specific AI framework used.

Clean-Core Compliant AI Architecture Patterns

Side-by-Side AI on SAP BTP

SAPs Generative AI on SAP BTP reference architecture explicitly positions SAP BTP as the platform for AI workloads, with S/4HANA and other SAP cloud solutions used as systems of record.

In a side-by-side pattern:

  • SAP S/4HANA
    • Hosts standard business processes and transactional data.
    • Exposes business functionality via released OData/REST APIs and events.
  • SAP BTP (AI and application layer)
    • Runs AI workloads using SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad, where models and pipelines can be implemented in Python or other languages.
    • Uses SAP Generative AI Hub for LLM access, prompt orchestration, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agentic scenarios.
  • Integration
    • Uses SAP Integration Suite, API Management and/or Event Mesh to connect AI components with S/4HANA through supported interfaces.

 

                       

AI workloads remain in the BTP extension layer, while SAP S/4HANA stays as the clean, standard core accessed via published APIs.

This pattern adheres to clean core because all custom AI logic and orchestration stay outside the S/4HANA core, while S/4HANA is accessed only via documented integration points.

AI Enabled Data Layer with SAP HANA Cloud

SAP has started using the term AI enabled clean core with SAP HANA Cloud, referring to architectures where S/4HANA remains the core ERP and SAP HANA Cloud provides an intelligent data layer for analytics and AI-driven applications.

Key characteristics:

  • Operational data is exposed or replicated from S/4HANA to SAP HANA Cloud or SAP Datasphere in a governed way.
  • AI models (classical ML or generative) are trained and executed against this data layer.
  • AI outputs are surfaced in side-by-side applications or written back into S/4HANA via APIs and standard extension points.

The core ERP remains clean and standard. AI driven logic is implemented in the surrounding data and application layers, which aligns with SAPs stated goal of increasing the pace of innovation and leveraging business value through reliable data and AI innovations without compromising the core.

Programming Language and Clean Core Compliance

A frequent objection is that AI solutions are implemented in Python or with non-SAP frameworks and therefore cannot be reconciled with clean core.

From SAPs standpoint, this is not correct. The clean core strategy focuses on minimizing custom code inside the core and using side-by-side extensions on SAP BTP to build new applications and innovations.

SAPs own extensibility guidance explicitly acknowledges BTP side-by-side extensions implemented in ABAP Cloud, Java, Node.js and other languages. AI services developed in Python and deployed on SAP AI Core or container runtimes on BTP fall into exactly the same category.

Clean core compliance therefore depends on:

  • The location of the code (outside S/4HANA vs. in-core modifications).
  • The integration pattern (released APIs and events vs. direct table access).

It does not depend on whether the AI logic is written in ABAP, Python, Java or another language.

 

                                    

AI solutions built on SAP BTP and SAP HANA Cloud surrounding a clean SAP S/4HANA core, with integration strictly via APIs and events.

 

SAPs clean core strategy is often misunderstood as a constraint on innovation. It provides the architectural discipline required to adopt AI at scale without compromising the stability and upgradeability of SAP S/4HANA.

By:

  • keeping AI workloads on SAP BTP and SAP HANA Cloud,
  • integrating through released APIs and events, and
  • applying SAPs extensibility guidance consistently,

organizations can build advanced AI solutions that are fully aligned with clean core principles. The question is not whether AI is compatible with clean core, but whether AI architectures are designed to follow the same patterns that SAP itself recommends for any modern extension.

SAP AI Core SAP S/4HANA SAP HANA Cloud SAP Business Technology Platform SAP Event Mesh

entry.title: Re: Configuration and Submission of your UK VAT Return
entry.content:
Hi 

If you receiving this error in your Q system then the message that you have highlighted is what I am referring to.  When you are in P system and you click in Submit you are submitting your actual VAT return to HMRC.  This will be your actual VAT return for that reporting period.  

With regards to your issue about not seeing HMRC details, client secrets etc please refer the link Granting Permission to Submit the VAT Return Report Electronically.  The first time you submit your VAT return it will direct you to the HMRC portal.  Here you will prompted to enter you user and password and grant permission to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to electronically submit your VAT report.  It is at this point where the access tokens are exchanged.  You do not get to see the client secret but they are stored.   

I hope that helps.  

Kind Regards

Sam.

entry.title: Enhancing the Power of Customer Data through the SAP BDC Partner Ecosystem
entry.content:
Enhancing the Power of Customer Data through the SAP BDC Partner Ecosystem

There were 5 exabytes of information created between the dawn of civilization through 2003, but that much information is now created every two days. - Eric Schmidt, former Executive Chairman at Google

The needs of enterprise have changed. CXOs are now all business strategists and not merely department heads. Of course, keeping the lights on is still very important but advances in technology, including AI, now offer up endless possibilities for efficiency gains, productivity gains and insight that can truly unleash value.

But, where is this value buried? How does one mine it? And, how does one refine the raw product into something truly valuable?

Data is the gold

The answer to the first question is easy data is the gold! It always has been, But, now, it is being created at an exponentially larger scale than even just two decades ago, as pointed out by Eric Schmidt. The problems and challenges lie not in the data but in how to get at it, how to make sense of it.

All companies, large and small, generate so much business data compared to the recent past that basic processes have become more and more complex. When it comes to analysing this voluminous data, it can be daunting. Firstly, the sheer volume of data itself; then, there is the time consuming and thankless task of trying to join up data from different sources finance data looks different to HR data which looks different to logistics data and sales data and so on.

Customer have built up tremendous reservoirs of data during their corporate lifetimes. These reservoirs only continue to grow. With the increase in data comes a requisite increase in the challenges of tapping into this great resource.

The gold miners kit list

Even in a systems landscape of a single vendor, such as SAP, these datasets from different LoB systems can present challenges when it comes to joining them together. So, what tools do we need to mine this treasure trove of data buried deep in our various systems?

Over the years, customers have invested heavily in Business Warehouses, Data Lakes and a myriad of analytics solutions. Now, with the advent and rapid advances in AI, businesses are being driven towards a promising future where, miraculously perhaps, advances in AI magically solve all of our data issues, presenting us answers with unprecedented speed and clarity.

Really? According to McKinseys The state of AI in 2025: Agents, innovation, and transformation, were not quite there yet.

Enter SAPs Business Data Cloud (BDC). The single biggest innovation by SAP since the advent of S/4HANA.  SAP BDC brings together in one place, all of the components necessary to turn the data vision into reality. Moreover, customers who have invested in our BW systems will not see their investments wasted. Investments in BW will be able to be carried forward and connected into BDC to continue delivering the value they were designed for.

  • A fully managed software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution
  • Unifies and governs all SAP data and seamlessly connects with third-party data
  • Brings together SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Business Warehouse
  • Partnership with Databricks adds Databricks directly into SAP Business Data Cloud

Seeing the wood for the trees

Data is like garbage. Youd better know what you are going to do with it before you collect it. - Mark Twain

Remember the old adage, Garbage in, garbage out! How so very apt in these times of AI hype how useful can AI be if the data it relies on is garbage? How can you possibly see the wood for the trees?

SAP BDC brings together the various components needed to make sense of all of that tremendous data, regardless of volume or source, to transform the data in a way that ensures that data garbage is turned into data gold. Then, and only then, can AI make meaningful use of that data to deliver reliable, trustworthy and truly valuable business insight. In short, SAP BDC is a quantum leap for business data mining. It brings together the key components of data management and analysis to provide a singular toolset to power truly effective business AI.

Please [SAP], I want some more

The immortal words of Oliver Twist as penned by Charles Dickens, paraphrased, but just as applicable to data as to food, for hungry corporations. Would you like some more? Then, more you shall have!

SAP has a vast ecosystem of partners covering all aspects of software and services. SAP BDC gives our partners unprecedented opportunities to build innovation that drives even more impactful value for our mutual customers. The power of data unlocked by SAP BDC, combined with the incremental value enhanced by our partner offerings, will give our customers unparalleled competitive advantage.

Our strategic partners are already engaged in value-enhancing developments utilizing the power of SAP BDC, and the pipeline of partners looking to contribute via SAP BDC is growing. These use cases will enhance the customer value proposition across key business processes such as finance, customer experience, assets management and risk management. All of these partners and others with equally exciting use cases in the pipeline, will help to amplify as well as accelerate the adoption of SAP BDC.

entry.title: I have the same requirement to extend the Balance Confirmation form template. Has anyone implemented
IF_WEB_HTTP_CLIENT suppress sap_passport header
entry.content:
I am on SAP BTP ABAP Environment.

I want to make a call to a rest-api using if_web_http_client in combination with cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement and cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination

The API gives me an http code 400 with message that request has syntax errors. The call when using create_by_url is working just fine. 
I traced it back that in the call the header sap_passport gets set. The API cant handle that. There seems to be a similar problem in CPI: Solved: Suppress HTTP headers on SAP CPI HTTP adapter - SAP Community

I tried to deactive propertytype_send_sap_passport with

set_distributed_tracing_status( i_epp_status = abap_false ).

At the first two levels the attribute is set correctly, but on the third level it is set wrong as shown here in the screenshot:

So MO_HTTP_CLIENT->propertytype_send_sap_passport = 0.

MO_HTTP_CLIENT->MO_HTTP_CLIENT->propertytype_send_sap_passport = 0.

Buth then:
MO_HTTP_CLIENT->MO_HTTP_CLIENT->MO_CLIENT->propertytype_send_sap_passport = 1.

This is because when calling mo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination with cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement in class cl_http_client in method create_by_destination the function RFC_READ_HTTP_DESTINATION is called which returns epp_enabled = abap_true and the method set_distributed_tracing_status does not override it correctly. 

Seems to me like a bug in the code?
Is there any way to customize the field epp_enabled in Communication Systems or to set the value of the property to 0?

Thanks in advande!

Here is my template code:

DATA(lt_outbound_services) = lo_ca->get_outbound_services( ).

DATA(lv_outb_serv_id) = VALUE #( lt_outbound_services[ 1 ]-id OPTIONAL ).

 

DATA(lo_dbug_desto) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_url( 'https://api.evatr.vies.bzst.de/app/v1/abfrage' ).

DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(

comm_scenario = ms_service_customizing-CommunicationScenario

comm_system_id = lo_ca->get_comm_system_id( )

service_id = lv_outb_serv_id ).

 

IF debug = abap_false.

mo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination( lo_destination ).

ELSE.

mo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination( lo_dbug_desto ).

ENDIF.

 

mo_http_client->get_http_request( )->set_text( i_text = mv_json_http_body ).

mo_http_client->get_http_request( )->set_content_type( 'application/json' ).

mo_http_client->set_distributed_tracing_status( i_epp_status = abap_false ).

entry.title: Re: SAP CPI : How to extract SSH private key from SSH key entries in keystore?
entry.content:
@Christian_MRhere a sample script. just tried it, it works

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import com.sap.it.api.ITApiFactory;
import com.sap.it.api.keystore.KeystoreService;

def Message processData(Message message)
{
def body = new StringBuffer();
KeystoreService keyStoreService = ITApiFactory.getService(KeystoreService.class, null);

def certChain = keyStoreService.getCertificateChain("your_keypair_name");
for(int i = 0; i < certChain.size(); i++)
{
body.append("-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- ");
body.append(certChain[i].getEncoded().encodeBase64().toString().replaceAll('(.{64})','$1 '));
body.append(" -----END CERTIFICATE----- ");
}


body.append("-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- ");
body.append(keyStoreService.getKeyPair("kyour_keypair_name").getPrivate().getEncoded().encodeBase64().toString().replaceAll('(.{64})','$1 '));
body.append(" -----END PRIVATE KEY-----");

message.setBody(body.toString());

return message;
}

entry.title: Re: Difference between MMBE and MB52 screens
entry.content:
MMBE shows stock by storage location, batch, special stock (consignment, project stock, etc.). It reflects real-time stock including restrictions (unrestricted, quality, blocked). It excludes certain special stock categories unless you drill down.

MB52 is more of a reporting transaction. It aggregates stock values by material/plant/storage location. Depending on your selection parameters, MB52 may include special stocks (like project stock, consignment, sales order stock, subcontracting stock). That is why MB52 can show more than MMBE its pulling in additional categories.

For PYP, if the material is tied to a project (special stock indicator Q), MB52 often includes it in the totals. MMBE shows it separately under Special Stock Project. If youre only looking at unrestricted stock in MMBE, youll miss the project stock, but MB52 will add it into the total.

To reconcile, perform the following:

Check your MB52 selection screen. Look at the Special Stock indicators. If you include project stock, consignment, or sales order stock, MB52 will show higher totals. Run MB52 with filters to exclude special stocks if you want it to match MMBE.

Expand the material in MMBE and check if theres project stock, blocked stock, or quality inspection stock. These are often the reason MB52 looks larger.

entry.title: Building Pro-Code Extensions for SAP Mobile Start leveraging mobile native functionalities
entry.content:
We just concluded this year's SAP TechEd with two very insightful in-person events SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin (Nov 45) and SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore (Nov 2526). As depicted in the announcement blog post of my colleague Thilo Berndt, the mobile topics were again very well covered in various sessions and activities. As part of which, we were conducting a Hands-on Workshop both in Berlin and Bangalore called "CA260  Learn how to build your own app and use it in SAP Mobile Start", which we would like to recap in this blog post and highlight the most interesting technical aspects.

Overview

SAP Mobile Start is the native entry point to the SAP Business Suite, to all relevant business processes, data, and content. It provides access to native or web-responsive business apps along with other content and critical business information. This includes notifications and consolidated views on tasks, approval workflows, and SAP S/4HANA situations. SAP Mobile Start provides business information from SAP Start, SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, and SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. Non SAP content can be integrated as well. It runs on iOS, iPadOS and Android devices, on watchOS and Wear OS devices, and on Apple Vision

While one significant aspect of SAP Mobile Start is to provide access to SAPs role-specific standard content, such as business applications and tiles exposed from SAP S/4HANA via SAP Build Work Zone, this years SAP TechEd Hands-On Workshop CA260 centered on the ease of building pro-code extensions using SAP Build and specifically SAP Build Code with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Participants were able to experience the necessary steps in building and deploying such a pro-code extension, as well as how to specifically utilize mobile native capabilities within that extension, such as Widgets (e.g. on the iOS Home and Lockscreen) and (Push) Notifications.

The session material and exercises are available on Github within the repository SAP-samples/teched2025-CA260. We do highly recommend checking out the exercises and trying them out on your own development system environment. This blog post will provide a brief overview of the most important steps and technical activities. 

Please note that the session material on Github as well as some screenshots and code snippets in this blog post will contain usages of "###" as a placeholder for the participant number that was assigned in the hands-on workshop. Participants were instructed to replace these occurrences with their own participant number.

Building and Deploying the base version of the extension

The exercises started by building and deploying an initial version of the extension that the workshop is using as an example. As the initial version provided to participants, we are using a slightly modified version of the "Incidents Management" CAP sample application. The provided full-stack application and its dependencies are defined in the Multitarget Application descriptor (mta.yaml) which is being built and packaged into an mta archive (.mtar) during the build operation, which eventually gets deployed to the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), specifically SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment. While the workshop is making use of SAP Build Code and its productivity tooling for developing full-stack applications with CAP, building the MTA project and deploying the build artifact to the SAP BTP, you can as well use your IDE of choice such as Visual Studio Code.

Screenshot: Overview of the project structure

 With the deployment, the CAP application (in terms of the server logic) is running an application container on the Cloud Foundry Runtime. The UI of our full-stack application is realized using SAP Fiori Elements, which is generating the User Interface based on standard floorpans and UI annotations as part of the service definitions using CDS. The Fiori frontend application lives within the HTML5 Repository of the SAP BTP. While this would already be sufficient to expose our extension to SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start as an application tile and run the frontend within the shell of SAP Build Work Zone using its managed Approuter, we want to have more control over the visual representation. 

Frontend deployed to the HTML5 Repository; backend application deployed to Cloud Foundry

We can achieve this greater control by leveraging SAP Build Work Zone's content definition format the Common Data Model (CDM). The definition of which is documented here and represents a standardized data structure for defining business apps, their visual representation, the required roles, and the logical hierarchical structure in which business apps shall be organized using a concept called "Spaces & Pages". Such CDM structure can be supplied to the HTML5 Repository during deployment of our extension. In the workshop's repository, this definition resides in the /workzone/cdm.json file.

Integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone & SAP Mobile Start

For integrating our extension into SAP Build Work Zone, which makes it automatically available to SAP Mobile Start, we leverage a relatively new feature of the SAP Build Work Zone Channel Manager defining a HTML5 Business Solution. While we could also create a regular Content Provider, using the new Content Channel type "HTML5 Business Solution" further simplifies the process as we are not required to manage any design-time destination. The HTML5 repository is merging all deployed HTML5 applications and their CDM definition from a common "Business Solution", making it available for selection as a joint Content Channel by the "Business Solution" dropdown.

Creation of a HTML5 Business Solution Content Channel in SAP Build Work Zone

This value used for merging multiple HTML5 application belonging to the same business solution is done via a dedicated property ("service" under "sap.cloud") in the web applications manifest.json. If you want to read more about HTML5 Content Consumption capabilities of SAP Build Work Zone, we can recommend this excellent blog post from our colleague Rupam who is part of the SAP Build Work Zone team.

{
  "_version": "1.65.0",
  "sap.app": {
    "id": "com.sap.ca260.###",
    "type": "application",
    [...]
  },
  [...]
  "sap.cloud": {
    "public": true,
    "service": "ca260###"
  }
}

 After adding the Content Channel's role to our Site and making sure we have the role assigned to our desired users, we can see it exposed in SAP Build Work Zone using the browser as well as in SAP Mobile Start Nice! As defined in the /workzone/cdm.json file, the application tile of our built extension is placed onto a Page with the title "Apps from Participant CA260-000", which itself is available under a Space named "Extensions from CA260".

Deployed application visible in SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

Extending the app to make use of Widgets on your mobile device

The steps to extend now our application in order for it to be configurable as a Widget, for example on the iOS Homescreen or the Lockscreen, are actually much easier than you might think. SAP Mobile Start offers multiple types of Widgets. The one we will be using here is the "Business Info Widget", which can be configured to display any KPI that is available to SAP Mobile Start. In technical terms this means that we need to enhance the application tile of our extension to become a "Dynamic App Launcher". In the simplest case, these are tiles showing a number coming from a connected data service. In more complex scenarios, these can also display criticalities, trend and more information around the selected KPI.

The process to transform our basic tile into a Dynamic App Launcher is fairly simple. Within our web application's manifest.json file, we can add the required definition to make it such a dynamic tile and connect it to our OData service for incidents available in our CAP application. For our example, let's point to the OData count of incidents and filter for incidents that are not in status closed using the status_code property. The needed configuration resides within the inbound definition under the node "indicatorDataSource". In order to make this change visible on our environment, the updated version needs to be deployed and the Content Channel needs to be synced.

Transforming the application tile into a DynamicAppLauncher

 As a result, our application now appears a KPI tile on our Site and in SAP Mobile Start and we can monitor the automatically updated value both inside of SAP Mobile Start for example when accessing the Page or by adding the app into my favorites on the Start tab of SAP Mobile Start. This fact allows us to configure the same Dynamic App Launcher tile as a Widget, for instance to our iPhone's Homescreen.

Pro tip: Why not mirroring your iOS Widget of open incidents to your Mac or configure the same on your Apple Watch as a watch face complication?

The Dynamic App Launcher tile appearing in SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

 

Implementing our own (push) notifications

Let's now go one step further and implement our own notifications from our CAP application. The beauty of the integration via SAP Build Work Zone and SAP's notification framework leveraging the SAP Alert Notification Service on BTP is, that such notifications will automatically appear on our SAP Build Work Zone Site in the browser, in SAP Mobile Start under the notification bell as well as be delivered as a mobile native push notification to the mobile devices on which you use SAP Mobile Start. That's a game changer for informing your users about a time critical situation directly from your pro-code extensions.

For CAP based extensions, we can make use of the @cap-js/notifications plugin. The plugin communicates with the necessary APIs using a Destination that needs to be created in the SAP BTP Subaccount in which the application will run. By default it expects the name for the Destination to be SAP_Notifications if not configured differently. The values for this Destination can be retrieved from the Settings of SAP Build Work Zone (Administrator role required).

For sending actual notification from our CAP service, we need to define our desired NotificationTypes first in the /srv/notification-types.json. These defined types represent the blueprint for the actual notifications to be sent. They include the texts for the actual notifications in all the languages that shall be supported with dedicated placeholders which will be filled when the notification is actually triggered in the service logic. Below you can see an example for such a type:

{
    "NotificationTypeKey": "IncidentCreated",
    "NotificationTypeVersion": "1",
    "Templates": [
      {
        "Language": "en",
        "TemplatePublic": "New Incident created",
        "TemplateSensitive": "New incident created by {{customer}}",
        "TemplateGrouped": "Incident Status Update",
        "TemplateLanguage": "mustache",
        "Subtitle": "{{description}}"
      },
      {
        "Language": "de",
        "TemplatePublic": "Neuer Vorfall eingegangen",
        "TemplateSensitive": "Neuer Vorfall von {{customer}}",
        "TemplateGrouped": "Vorfall Status nderungen",
        "TemplateLanguage": "mustache",
        "Subtitle": "{{description}}"
      }
    ]
  }

Sending actual notification is fairly easy and can be done with very few lines of code. We first need to initialize the notifications plugin with cds.connect.to('notifications'), which creates a handle with which we can send notifications later. Sending notifications can be done with the function alert.notify. Here, we reference the desired NotificationType (defined before), recipients and further properties and data related to this specific notification we intend to send.

Coding used to send notification when incidents are created and closed.

 

 

As a result, we receive a push notification at the event of incident creation and closure. Already in the push notification displayed by the mobile operating system, we see the defined texts from our NotificationType with the specific values filled for the specific incident object. When tapping on this push notification, SAP Mobile Start shows the full notification in the dedicated area of the mobile app. Using "Open in Browser" brings us to this specific incident in our SAP Fiori Elements application where we could take further action. This is achieved by supplying the Intent Based Navigation (IBN) information of our app consisting of the Semantic Object and Action defined in our web application's manifest. This allows SAP Mobile Start and SAP Build Work Zone to open the right application as a navigation target from the exposed content in our case, the SAP Fiori Elements application running the HTML5 Repository and exposed to SAP Build Work Zone using the HTML5 Business Solution Content Channel.  The deep link to the specific incident object is achieved by supplying a special navigation target parameter that SAP Fiori Elements supports for opening the desired "Inner App Route" in our example, the Object Page of a specific incident using its ID. Feel free to check out how this was done for this specific example in the repositories' code.

 

The notification details visible in SAP Mobile Start and the deep-link navigation to the SAP Fiori Elements application

 

Outlook

We hope we were able to show, how easy it is to create pro-code extensions, deploy them to the SAP BTP, integrate them into SAP Build Work Zone & SAP Mobile Start. The demonstrated examples of mobile native widgets and push notifications hopefully showed the ease of leveraging the mobile native device capabilities. Beyond the content of the CA260 Hands-On Workshop of SAP TechEd 2025, we would like to give you an outlook to what else would be possible with this basis.

The beauty of using the HTML5 Business Solution Content Channel Exposure in SAP Build Work Zone is that we have the flexibility and feature set of the Common Data Model (CDM) available. We could further extend the /workzone/cdm.json file to make use of even richer visualization capabilities for example by defining a declarative UI Integration Card. Such cards allow to achieve UI richt micro-experiences right on the Page's structure, for example displaying a short list of incidents with the most important information to get a brief overview as a processor. In the browser when consuming the page via SAP Build Work Zone, the card is rendered as a regular SAP UI5 UI Integration Card. In SAP Mobile Start, declarative cards are supported as mobile native UI elements. With a single declarative definition of such a card using the UI Integration Card framework, we can achieve native cross-platform support with a high quality user experience directly within SAP Mobile Start.

Having a UI Integration Card added to the Page in SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

For further information on SAP Mobile Start related features and topics, please check our SAP Mobile Start documentation. Visit SAP Mobile Experience Community Page and click follow to get the latest development and innovation of our solutions. We look forward to hearing about your experience with these hands-on exercises; please do share your thoughts and comments below.

entry.title: Cloud Identity Services - GitHub at Your Service To Help with Feedback
entry.content:
Good documentation grows faster and better when users and authors work together. Thats exactly the spirit behind the initiative we started some time ago by opening the SAP Cloud Identity Services documentation to community feedback via GitHub.

Your questions, issues, and edits have directly helped us improve the documentation and shape Cloud Identity Services for the community. Please continue to share your experiences whether its a quick correction, a clarification, or a new example every contribution helps.

Why this matters for Cloud Identity Services users and authors:

  • Faster fixes and clearer guidance: When you report unclear wording or missing information, we - the authors can respond and update docs more quickly.
  • Direct collaboration: Instead of waiting for a support ticket or guessing, you can open a conversation right where the documentation lives.
  • Learn and contribute: Submitting edits is a great way to share real-world tips or correct examples that help everyone.

Thank you! and keep the feedback coming. 

But how to do that? See the links in More Information below.

entry.title: Re: Invoice Receipt Workflow with ERS (Evaluated Receipt...
entry.content:
Hello @AikoFC 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details

Supplier Invoice,  Supplier Evaluation, Workflow for Supplier Invoice Approval, How to Configure the Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices,

In summary to your question, in public cloud, ERS invoices do not trigger supplier-invoice workflows because workflow processing only applies to parked and balanced invoices. They are not eligible for workflow because ERS postings are automatically created from the system as documents. Due to its clean-core principle, public cloud also does not provide and configuration, BAdI or extensibility option that adds workflow support.

I suggest you use situation handling or central monitoring apps if you require governance on ERS.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: In public cloud how to get Sales Order Header Text
entry.content:
Dear @Krithik,

In Public Cloud the clean core read SO texts via the released Sales Order (A2X) API (API_SALES_ORDER_SRV)

Sales order header texts:

  • GET .../sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrder('<SalesOrder>')/to_Text
    or (if you also need header fields)
  • GET .../sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrder('<SalesOrder>')?$expand=to_Text

Sales order item texts:

  • GET .../sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrderItem(SalesOrder='<SalesOrder>',SalesOrderItem='<Item>')/to_Text

The text payload uses fields like LongTextID / LongText (and language-dependent handling), which is exactly how A2X exposes long texts.

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3282990

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/03c04db2a7434731b7fe21dca77440da/5e78feff2ce74328b7305146f61b88da.html

https://api.sap.com/api/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/resource/Sales_Order_Header

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/03c04db2a7434731b7fe21dca77440da/00d244581efca007e10000000a441470.html?profile=20020833

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Can the S4/HANA Public Cloud Updates overwrite my Customizing without Z or Y?
entry.content:
we have to extend some entries in IMG, e.g. the valuation classes to implement the material account determination according our customers requirement. Ideally we can do it by using the same primary keys as we have on another SAP system the customers runs. There the primary keys are fully numeric. We have concerns to follow the same nomenclature in public cloud. Will IMG entries which dont start with Z or Y be overwritten by future updates, in the case SAP will release new standard entries which are congruent to the entries we set up.

In on premise systems you can check through the delivery class of tables by yourself. There you can identify if the table is protected against SAP updates or if you have to protect your entries by using the Z/Y namespace.

Generally we want to prevent that updates will overwrite entries we will do when customize the system.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Task creation for production posting change...
entry.content:
Dear @ST24,

In Public Cloud you currently cant schedule WT creation for Posting Change (SPC) documents. The Schedule Warehouse Task Creation mechanism and the job-template behavior you saw with /SCWM/R_DLV_PDO_CREATE_WT_JT supports delivery types like outbound (PDO), but not posting change (SPC).

SAP even documents this limitation: Currently, it is not supported to create warehouse task for posting change (SPC) with app Schedule Warehouse Task Creation.

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3126148

What you can do instead:

  • Manual or mass creation via Warehouse Monitor: SAP recommended workaround is to use Warehouse Monitor to create WTs for posting change documents
  • If you need true scheduled/unattended WT creation for SPC in Publlic Cloud, raise an SAP incident / feature request and reference SAP Note 3126148

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Integrating Non-SAP Semi-Structured Invoices Data with SAP BDC Using SAP Databricks
entry.content:
Struggling to bridge the gap between your non-SAP data and your SAP data  without creating costly data silos or duplicates?

In this blog post, we demonstrate how SAP Databricks can efficiently extract semi-structured data like PDF invoices from an external S3 bucket, derive some insights and share the results as a customer managed data product with SAP BDC using the zero-copy approach.

This not only accelerates data-driven insights but also:

  • Lowers storage costs
  • Simplifies your data landscape
  • Supports a framework for handling other semi-structured or unstructured data, which can be a common obstacle in data and analytics strategies

This is high level how the architecture of the scenario looks like:

The source pdf files (invoices) from the S3 bucket we are reading from, have the following format:

Below is a step-by-step breakdown of what we will do and more context is provided as we progress:

  • List the prerequisites and some additional configurations
  • Install pypdf for the parsing of the semi-structured pdf files
  • Ingest the PDF invoices from our S3 bucket as binaryFile
  • Parse them with pypdf
  • Write the result into a Delta table named bt_delta_table_invoice_pdf.
  • Train a scikitlearn RandomForestRegressor to predict Payment Delays, register it in Unity Catalog Model Registry, and do batch inference.
  • Persist the result set in the delta table bt_delta_table_invoices_payment_delay_prediction in SAP Databricks.
  • Create a Delta Share using the Delta table and publish it as a Data Product to the SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) Catalog using the zerocopy sharing concept.
  • As a last step of this blog we'll retrieve our shared SAP DBX data product in the SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) Catalog

0) Prerequisites

  • SAP Databricks (Unity Catalogenabled workspace).
  • S3 bucket with invoices (PDFs). See this nice blog from my colleague @jing_wen on how to connect an S3 bucket as an external location in SAP Databricks
  • A Unity Catalog Volume (e.g., /Volumes/babacar/default/checkpoints) you can write to.
  • Privileges to create/alter Delta tables and register models in Unity Catalog.

1) Configuration

We are reading the pdf files from an S3 bucket in streaming mode, parsing them on the fly usingpypdf and writing to a Delta table, using a volume (e.g., /Volumes/babacar/default/checkpoints/pdf_ingest). This ensures that our streaming job can reliably:

  • track the progress of data that has been processed.
  • recover from failures by resuming from the last successful state.
  • and prevent duplicate data from being written to the Delta table.
CATALOG   = "babacar"
SCHEMA    = "default"
TABLE     = "bt_delta_table_invoices_pdf"   # <- my target table for the storage of the parsed pdf files

S3_src="s3a://vpbdcpd/NON_SAP_Unstructured/invoices/babacar/"

# Safe checkpoint path in a Unity Catalog Volume
CHKPT     = f"/Volumes/{CATALOG}/{SCHEMA}/checkpoints/pdf_ingest"

FULL_TABLE = f"{CATALOG}.{SCHEMA}.{TABLE}"

To ensures our workflows are compatible and secure in the SAP Databricks environment,we'll use /Volumes/... instead of /tmp or /FileStore for all checkpoints.

2) Install pypdf

Let's start by installing the pypdf library in our Databricks environment.

%pip install pypdf

pypdf extracts text from digitally generated PDFs (with a text layer). For scanned PDFs (imageonly pages), there is the option to use AWS Textract as a fallback (async APIs for PDFs).

3) Create the Delta table (constraints + table properties)

Now we create our target Delta table babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoice_pdf for the storage of the extracted pdf files and add some constraints such as NOT NULL to help enforce data quality and integrity and ensure that only valid data is written to the table, preventing issues like missing required fields or invalid values.

CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS babacar.default;

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoices_pdf (
  Id_Nr               STRING      NOT NULL,
  Name                STRING,
  Surname             STRING,
  Sex                 STRING,
  Address             STRING,
  Invoice_Nr          STRING,
  Payment_Deadline    DATE,
  Paid_At             DATE,
  Delay               INT,
  source_file         STRING
)
USING DELTA
TBLPROPERTIES (
  delta.enableChangeDataFeed = true,     -- enable CDF
  delta.enableDeletionVectors = false    -- keep Copy-on-Write; 
);

ALTER TABLE babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoice_pdf
  ADD CONSTRAINT chk_delay_nonneg CHECK (Delay IS NULL OR Delay >= 0);

In the above code, notice that we have configured two properties on the delta table that is created:

  • Change Data Feed (CDF) is set to true which enables rowlevel change tracking for incremental consumers.
  • Deletion Vectors (DV) is set to false for compatibility (you can enable later if you want Merge-on-Read (MoR) updates).

These properties help manage how data changes are tracked and how deletes/updates are handled in our Delta table.

4) pypdf parser for invoice fields extraction

With the code below we first extract semi-structured invoice fields from PDF files by reading the PDF bytes, normalizing the text, and applying regular expressions to find key fields like ID_Nr, name, address, and dates. It uses the pypdf library to read the PDF and returns a dictionary of extracted values, handling missing or malformed PDFs. The approach enables automated extraction of relevant data from semi-structured invoice documents for further analysis.

import re
from io import BytesIO
from typing import Dict, Optional
from pypdf import PdfReader

# Define regex patterns for each invoice field to extract
_PATTERNS = {
    "Id_Nr"            : r"(?:^|\b)Id[_\s-]*Nr\b[:\s]*([A-Za-z0-9_-]+)",
    "Name"             : r"(?:^|\b)Name\b[:\s]*([A-Za-z---'`-]+)",
    "Surname"          : r"(?:^|\b)Surname\b[:\s]*([A-Za-z---'`-]+)",
    "Sex"              : r"(?:^|\b)Sex\b[:\s]*(Male|Female|Other|[MFmf])",
    "Address"          : r"(?:^|\b)Address\b[:\s]*([\s\S]+?)(?=\s+(?:Invoice[_\s-]*Nr|Payment[_\s-]*Deadline|Paid[_\s-]*At|Delay|Name|Surname|Sex)\b|$)",
    "Invoice_Nr"       : r"(?:^|\b)Invoice[_\s-]*Nr\b[:\s]*([A-Za-z0-9_-]+)",
    "Payment_Deadline" : r"(?:^|\b)Payment[_\s-]*Deadline\b[:\s]*([0-9]-[0-9]-[0-9])",
    "Paid_At"          : r"(?:^|\b)Paid[_\s-]*At\b[:\s]*([0-9]-[0-9]-[0-9])",
    "Delay"            : r"(?:^|\b)Delay\b[:\s]*([0-9]+)"
}

def _normalize_text(t: str) -> str:
    # Replace special characters and extra spaces for cleaner matching
    return re.sub(r"[ \t]+", " ", t.replace("", " ")).strip()

def extract_invoice_fields_from_bytes(pdf_bytes: bytes) -> Dict[str, Optional[str]]:
    try:
        # Read PDF content from bytes and extract text from all pages
        reader = PdfReader(BytesIO(pdf_bytes))
        pages_text = [(p.extract_text() or "") for p in reader.pages]
        full_text  = _normalize_text("\n".join(pages_text))
    except Exception:
        # If PDF cannot be read, return all fields as None
        return {k: None for k in _PATTERNS.keys()}

    # Initialize output dictionary with None for all fields
    out = {k: None for k in _PATTERNS.keys()}
    # Search for each field using its regex pattern
    for k, pat in _PATTERNS.items():
        m = re.search(pat, full_text, flags=re.IGNORECASE|re.MULTILINE)
        if m:
            out[k] = m.group(1).strip()

    # Standardize the Sex field to "M", "F", or "Other"
    if out["Sex"]:
        s = out["Sex"].lower()
        out["Sex"] = "M" if s in ("male","m") else ("F" if s in ("female","f") else "Other")
    return out

5) Read PDF files as binary from an S3 bucket in streaming mode**

In this step, we are extracting invoice fields from each file using a custom function in a streaming mode and then we write the parsed results into the bt_delta_table_invoices_pdf table. The process handles files in small groups, keeps track of what has already been processed and ensures that nothing is missed or duplicated, even if there are problems or interruptions.

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# Read PDF files as binary from S3 in streaming mode, select content and file path
raw = (
    spark.readStream
         .format("cloudFiles")
         .option("cloudFiles.format", "binaryFile")
         .option("cloudFiles.includeExistingFiles", "true")
         .load(S3_SRC)
         .select(
             F.col("content"),
             F.col("_metadata.file_path").alias("source_file")  # Use file path as source identifier
         )
)

# Function to process each micro-batch of files
def process_batch(batch_df, epoch_id: int):
    if batch_df.rdd.isEmpty():
        return

    # Collect all rows in the batch
    rows = batch_df.select("source_file","content").collect()
    parsed_rows = []
    for r in rows:
        sf, bts = r["source_file"], r["content"]
        # Extract invoice fields from PDF bytes
        fields = extract_invoice_fields_from_bytes(bts if bts is not None else b"")
        parsed_rows.append((
            fields["Id_Nr"], fields["Name"], fields["Surname"], fields["Sex"],
            fields["Address"], fields["Invoice_Nr"], fields["Payment_Deadline"],
            fields["Paid_At"], int(fields["Delay"]) if fields["Delay"] else None,
            sf
        ))

    if parsed_rows:
        # Create DataFrame from parsed rows and cast date columns
        out_df = spark.createDataFrame(parsed_rows, schema="""
            Id_Nr STRING, Name STRING, Surname STRING, Sex STRING, Address STRING,
            Invoice_Nr STRING, Payment_Deadline STRING, Paid_At STRING, Delay INT,
            source_file STRING
        """)
        out_df = (out_df
                  .withColumn("Payment_Deadline", F.to_date("Payment_Deadline"))
                  .withColumn("Paid_At",          F.to_date("Paid_At")))
        # Append results to Delta table
        out_df.write.mode("append").format("delta").saveAsTable(FULL_TABLE)

# Start the streaming query with checkpointing and batch processing
(
    raw.writeStream
       .option("checkpointLocation", CHKPT)
       .trigger(availableNow=True)   # Use availableNow trigger for incremental batch
       .foreachBatch(process_batch)
       .start()
).awaitTermination()

6) Verify

Let's now verify if the data have been saved successfully into the target table bt_delta_table_invoice_pdf.

The DESCRIBE EXTENDED statement provide detailed information about the table properties defined in a previous step like Change Data Feed (CDF) and Deletion Vectors (DV).

%sql
SELECT * 
FROM babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoices_pdf
ORDER BY source_file
LIMIT 20;

DESCRIBE EXTENDED babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoices_pdf;  -- properties (CDF/DV) visible

Result of the verification:

  • Properties of the Delta table:
  • Content of the Delta table:

Glancing at the results, we can confirm that the data has been extracted successfully and the delta table is ready to be used.

7) ML training (scikitlearn) + UC Model Registry + inference

The first code block trains a Random Forest model to predict invoice payment delay using features engineered from the Delta table, logs the model and metrics to MLflow and registers the model as Champion in Unity Catalog. The second code block loads theChampion model as a Spark User-Defined Function (UDF) and applies it to the feature DataFrame for batch inference, adding a predicted delay column.

# Install scikit-learn if not already installed
%pip install -q scikit-learn

import numpy as np, pandas as pd, pyspark.sql.functions as F
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score, mean_squared_error, mean_absolute_error
import mlflow, mlflow.sklearn
from mlflow.models.signature import infer_signature
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient

CATALOG, SCHEMA = "babacar", "default"
SOURCE_TABLE = f"{CATALOG}.{SCHEMA}.bt_delta_table_invoices_pdf"
MODEL_NAME   = f"{CATALOG}.{SCHEMA}.invoice_delay_model"

mlflow.set_registry_uri("databricks-uc")  # Use Unity Catalog for model registry

# Feature engineering: create features from the Delta table
fe = (
  spark.table(SOURCE_TABLE)
       .withColumn("name_len",     F.length("Name"))
       .withColumn("surname_len",  F.length("Surname"))
       .withColumn("addr_len",     F.length("Address"))
       .withColumn("sex_idx",      F.when(F.col("Sex")=="M",1).when(F.col("Sex")=="F",0).otherwise(2).cast("int"))
       .withColumn("deadline_year",  F.year("Payment_Deadline").cast("int"))
       .withColumn("deadline_month", F.month("Payment_Deadline").cast("int"))
       .withColumn("deadline_day",   F.dayofmonth("Payment_Deadline").cast("int"))
       .select("Delay","name_len","surname_len","addr_len","sex_idx","deadline_year","deadline_month","deadline_day")
       .dropna(subset=["Delay"])  # Remove rows with missing target
       .limit(200_000)            # Limit to 200,000 rows for training
)
pdf = fe.toPandas()  # Convert to Pandas DataFrame for sklearn

# Prepare features and target
X = pdf[["name_len","surname_len","addr_len","sex_idx","deadline_year","deadline_month","deadline_day"]].fillna(0)
y = pd.to_numeric(pdf["Delay"], errors="coerce").fillna(0.0).astype(float)

# Split into train and test sets
Xtr, Xte, ytr, yte = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.2, random_state=7)

with mlflow.start_run(run_name="train_invoice_delay_model") as run:
    params = dict(n_estimators=200, max_depth=8, random_state=7, n_jobs=-1)
    model = RandomForestRegressor(**params).fit(Xtr, ytr)  # Train model

    y_pred = model.predict(Xte)  # Predict on test set
    r2  = r2_score(yte, y_pred)
    rmse= float(np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(yte, y_pred)))
    mae = float(mean_absolute_error(yte, y_pred))

    # Log parameters and metrics to MLflow
    mlflow.log_params(params)
    mlflow.log_metrics({"r2": r2, "rmse": rmse, "mae": mae})

    # Log model with signature and input example
    sig = infer_signature(Xtr, model.predict(Xtr))
    mlflow.sklearn.log_model(model, "model", signature=sig, input_example=Xtr.iloc[:5])

    # Register model in Unity Catalog and set alias "Champion"
    registered = mlflow.register_model(model_uri=f"runs:/{run.info.run_id}/model", name=MODEL_NAME)
    MlflowClient().set_registered_model_alias(MODEL_NAME, alias="Champion", version=registered.version)

print({"r2": r2, "rmse": rmse, "mae": mae})

UC Model Registry uses 3level names (catalog.schema.model) and the databricks-uc registry URI.

Batch inference (Spark UDF) with the Champion version:

This part of the pipeline operationalizes the trained invoice delay prediction model. It first engineers the same features used during training from the latest invoice data. The registered MLflow model Champion is loaded as a Spark UDF (User-Defined Function) and applied to these features, generating a predicted payment delay for each invoice. The results are then written to a Delta table babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoices_payment_delay_predictions for persistent storage and easy downstream analysis.

from pyspark.sql import functions as F
import mlflow

PREDICTIONS_TABLE = "babacar.default.bt_delta_table_invoices_payment_delay_predictions"

# Feature engineering: create features for prediction
features = (
    spark.table(SOURCE_TABLE)
    .withColumn("name_len", F.length("Name"))           # Length of Name
    .withColumn("surname_len", F.length("Surname"))     # Length of Surname
    .withColumn("addr_len", F.length("Address"))        # Length of Address
    .withColumn("sex_idx",                             # Encode Sex as integer
        F.when(F.col("Sex") == "M", 1)
         .when(F.col("Sex") == "F", 0)
         .otherwise(2).cast("int")
    )
    .withColumn("deadline_year", F.year("Payment_Deadline").cast("int"))   # Year of deadline
    .withColumn("deadline_month", F.month("Payment_Deadline").cast("int")) # Month of deadline
    .withColumn("deadline_day", F.dayofmonth("Payment_Deadline").cast("int")) # Day of deadline
    .select(
        "name_len",
        "surname_len",
        "addr_len",
        "sex_idx",
        "deadline_year",
        "deadline_month",
        "deadline_day"
    )
)

# Load the registered MLflow model as a Spark UDF
predict_udf = mlflow.pyfunc.spark_udf(
    spark,
    model_uri=f"models:/{MODEL_NAME}@Champion",
    env_manager="local"
)

# Apply the model to the features to get predictions
scored = features.withColumn(
    "predicted_delay",
    predict_udf(F.struct(*features.columns))
)

# Write predictions to a Delta table, overwriting if it exists
scored.write.mode("overwrite").option("overwriteSchema", "true").format("delta").saveAsTable(PREDICTIONS_TABLE)

# Display the predictions
display(scored)

9) Share the prediction Delta table to SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) (Delta Sharing)

Let's now create a share BT_DDP_dbx_s3_invoices_predicted, grant access to SAP BDC as a recipient, enabling secure data sharing from Databricks to external consumers. A share is a mechanism for distributing and accessing data across different systems. Creating or updating a share involves including specific attributes, such as @openResourceDiscoveryV1 in the request body, aligning with the Open Resource Discovery protocol. This procedure ensures that the share is properly structured and described according to specified standards, facilitating effective data sharing and management.

Let's install first the BDC Connect SDK:

%pip install sap-bdc-connect-sdk

Then create the share or update it, if already existing:

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "sap-business-data-cloud"))

share_name = "bt_ddp_dbx_s3_invoices_predicted"


open_resource_discovery_information = {
    "@openResourceDiscoveryV1": {
        "title": "CP_dbx_dp_s3_invoices_prediction",
        "shortDescription": "The table contains data related to invoice predictions and actual outcomes.",
        "description": "The table contains data related to deadlines and predictions of delays. It includes metrics such as the lengths of names, surnames, and addresses, as well as demographic information and specific deadline dates. This data can be used for analyzing patterns in delays, understanding the impact of personal information on deadlines, and improving project management processes."
            }
        }

response = bdc_connect_client.create_or_update_share(
    share_name,
    open_resource_discovery_information
)
print(f"[REQUEST] Create or update share request was executed and returned {response}")

10) Create or update share CSN

The CSN serves as a standardized format for configuring and describing shares within a network. To create or update the CSN for a share, it's advised to prepare the CSN content in a separate file and include this content in the request body. This approach ensures accuracy and compliance with the CSN interoperability specifications, facilitating consistent and effective share configuration across systems.

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.utils import csn_generator

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "sap-business-data-cloud"))

share_name = "bt_ddp_dbx_s3_invoices_predicted"

csn_schema = csn_generator.generate_csn_template(share_name)

response = bdc_connect_client.create_or_update_share_csn(
    share_name,
    csn_schema
)
print(f"[REQUEST] Create or update CSN request was executed and returned {response if response else 'OK'}")

11) Publish a Data Product

A Data Product is an abstract representation of a specific type of data or dataset within a system, tailored to meet specific business needs, streamline management and allow sharing across multiple platforms. It bundles resources or API endpoints to enable efficient data access and utilization by integrated systems. Publishing a Data Product allows these systems to access and consume the data, ensuring seamless communication and resource sharing.

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.utils import csn_generator

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "sap-business-data-cloud"))

share_name = "bt_ddp_dbx_s3_invoices_predicted"

response = bdc_connect_client.publish_data_product(
    share_name
)
print(f"[REQUEST] Publish Data Product request was executed and returned {response if response else 'OK'}")

12) Retrieve your shared Databricks Data Product in SAP BDC Catalog

Use the title of the share defined in the ORD document in step 9

We can search for it in the BDC Catalog in SAP Datasphere or in the SAP BDC Cockpit. Please bear in mind that the newly published data product might take a couple of minutes to appear in the SAP BDC Catalog:

You can find more information about the data product in the Properties and the Details sections. This data product would qualify as a customer managed or custom data product.

The data product is now ready to use and share for all analytical and AI/ML use cases!

--------------------------------------------

In the next blog part: Scheduling the Databricks job using the BDC Datasphere Task Chain to get updates from the ML model
